GeolocationPosition.summary: The GeolocationPosition interface represents the position of the concerned device at a given time. The position, represented by a object, comprehends the 2D position of the device, on a spheroid representing the Earth, but also its altitude and its speed.

GeolocationPositionCoords.summary: The coords read-only property of the interface returns a object representing a geographic position. It contains the location, that is longitude and latitude on the Earth, the altitude, and the speed of the object concerned, regrouped inside the returned value. It also contains accuracy information about these values.

GeolocationPositionTimestamp.summary: The timestamp read-only property of the interface represents the date and time that the position was acquired by the device.
GeolocationPositionTimestamp.value: A number containing a timestamp, given as Unix time in milliseconds.

GeolocationPositionToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
GeolocationPositionToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
